Many Arab and Muslim American individuals and organizations received threats, Arab Americans were denied entry on planes and had home loan applications rejected.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Asian American,Middle East/North Africa", "date": "2001-09-18", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:10:05Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "4769659698020352", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:10:05Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: M33"},{"tags": "", "text": "Ali Almansoop, a U.S. citizen of Yemeni descent, is shot in the back while escaping from his attacker who had broken into his home in Lincoln Park, Michigan.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Middle East/North Africa", "date": "2001-09-19", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:10:06Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "4693816212717568", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:10:06Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: M36"},{"tags": "", "text": "In the first month after the 9/11 attacks, the Sikh Coalition documents over 300 cases of violence and discrimination against Sikh Americans throughout the United States. Sikhs practice a different religion than Muslims but due to the Sikh turban, beard, and appearing \u2018brown\u2019, which are some characteristics these two groups share, people often misidentify and conflate the two groups together. The victims of this violence are not limited to one nationality or religion.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Asian American,Middle East/North Africa", "date": "2001-10", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:10:06Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "4686456517820416", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:10:06Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: M34"},{"tags": "", "text": "War in Afghanistan in response to the September 11 attacks. The aim is to dismantle Al-Qaeda and remove the Taliban from power.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Middle East/North Africa", "date": "2001-10-07-2014-12-28", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:10:11Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "5363584955580416", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:10:11Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: M42"},{"tags": "", "text": "The Sept. 11 attacks in NYC set the stage for \u201cnational security\u201d based immigration policy. Congress passes the PATRIOT Act, which gives the federal government broad powers to detain suspected \u201cterrorists\u201d for unlimited periods of time without access to legal representation. Over 1,2000 Arab, Muslim, and South Asian men are detained in secret", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Asian American,Middle East/North Africa", "date": "2001-10-26", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:10:10Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "5839608260591616", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:10:10Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: M41"},{"tags": "", "text": "Guantanamo Bay Detention Camp is established by Secretary of Defense, Donald Rumsfeld, to detain \u2018extraordinarily dangerous people and prosecute detainees for war crimes\u2019. Obama proposes to close Guantanamo Bay but it remains open despite president Obama\u2019s proposal to close it. Since 2001, there have been about 800 detainees, all of whom were males aged 13-80 years old from countries including Afghanistan, Saudi Arabia, Yemen, Pakistan, Algeria, China, Algeria, and Russia.  More than 2,000 FBI agents have reported abusive treatment of Guantanamo prisoners.  Torture techniques included sexual assault/humiliation techniques such as being somodized with broomsticks, forcing undress, rape, threatening rape, being anally probed. Other torture techniques included sleep and sensory deprivation, sensory bombardment, solitary confinement/isolation, mock execution, forced medication, the use of dogs to scare detainees, temperature extremes, waterboarding, and watching others being tortured.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Middle East/North Africa", "date": "2002-01", "qtype": "D", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:10:13Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "6476001617903616", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:10:13Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: M47"},{"tags": "", "text": "Attorney General John Ashcroft announces implementation of a new \"Special Registration\" program as part of a larger National Security Entry-Exit Registration System (NSEERS) requiring Port-of-Entry Registration. Registration is required for men from 25 Arab, Muslim, and South Asian countries. Men who refuse to register face deportation.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Asian American,Middle East/North Africa", "date": "2002-11", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:10:13Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "5440018193580032", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:10:13Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: M46"},{"tags": "", "text": "The Department of Homeland Security takes over responsibility for all immigration enforcement and security", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Latino/as,Asian American,Middle East/North Africa", "date": "2003", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:10:17Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "5399987353550848", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:10:17Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: M52"},{"tags": "", "text": "Kamehameha Schools defends its \"Hawaiians-only\" admissions policy against a lawsuit by a non-Hawaiian. In November, District Judge Alan Cooke Kay dismisses the lawsuit finding that the policy serves a \"legitimate, remedial purpose by improving native Hawaiians' socioeconomic and educational disadvantages\". In 2005, the ruling is reversed by the 9th Circuit of Appeals. Kamehameha lawyers describe the ruling as \"unprecedented\" noting \u201cit is the first in our nation's history to invalidate a remedial education policy by a private school for the benefit of any minority group, much less an indigenous people.\" The ruling is followed by large protests prompting the 9th Circuit to re-hear the appeal en banc in 2006, after which they restore the original ruling. The case is then appealed to the U.S. Supreme Court but settled before being heard for $7 million. Attorneys Eric Grant and David Rosen file another suit against Kamehameha the same day on behalf of four other non-Hawaiian students.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Native American", "date": "2003-06", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:10:23Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "4703001805586432", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:10:23Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: N163"},{"tags": "", "text": "In the most important affirmative action decision since the <a href=\"#B188\">Bakke case</a>, the Supreme Court (5\u20134) upholds the University of Michigan Law School's policy, ruling that race can be one of many factors considered by colleges when selecting their students because it furthers \"a compelling interest in obtaining the educational benefits that flow from a diverse student body.\" \r\nIn separate decisions, the high court strikes down a point system used by the University of Michigan\u2019s undergraduate programs but approves a separate policy used by the University of Michigan law school that gives race less prominence in the admissions decision-making process.", "refs": "[]", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "African American", "date": "2003-06-23", "qtype": "D", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:10:17Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "6521777110908928", "modified": "2018-09-12T19:32:02Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: B227"},{"tags": "", "text": "President Bush authorizes the Military Commissions Act, further subjecting Guantanamo Bay detainees to laws that significantly deviate from the traditional U.S. standards of justice. By December, over 750 individuals all labeled \u2018enemy combatants\u2019 are being held on the base without having been tried or even formally charged.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Middle East/North Africa", "date": "2006-10", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:10:28Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "4736330751803392", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:10:28Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: M58"},{"tags": "", "text": "ICE conducts the largest single-workplace immigration raid in U.S. history in Laurel Mississippi. The raid causes panic among Hispanic families in the area after federal agents detain at least 600 workers. Workers are taken to an immigration detention facility nearly 200 miles from their homes and family, and only some parents are released to return to their children with monitoring devices. The ACLU receives reports that workers were segregated by race or ethnicity and interrogated, denied counsel, and that family members and lawyers were not informed about where the workers were being held. The ACLU begins investigating the ICE\u2019s conduct.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Latino/as", "date": "2008-08", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:10:44Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "5828901712429056", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:10:44Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: L136"},{"tags": "", "text": "Barack Obama is elected the first African American President of the United States of America. President Obama identifies as African American, but openly acknowledges and discusses his multiracial heritage. Michelle Obama becomes the first African American First Lady in U.S. history.", "refs": "", "pic": "6473313773682688", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "African American,Multiracial", "date": "2008-11-04", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:10:46Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "6473313773682688", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:10:46Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: B238"},{"tags": "", "text": "Princeton University conducts a survey finding that Asian Americans needed to score 140 points higher than whites for admission to top universities. This plays into the \u201cmodel minority\u201d myth where Asian Americans are portrayed as being more successful than their white counterparts in academic settings.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Asian American", "date": "2009", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:10:48Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "5812356424663040", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:10:48Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: A186"},{"tags": "", "text": "President Obama signs legislation funding legal settlements with Black farmers and Native Americans. $1.15 billion is allocated for the settlement of the 1997 Pigford v. Glickman case against the U.S. Agriculture Department over claims of discrimination against Black farmers in the allocation of farm loans and assistance. $3.4 billion is allocated for the settlement reached with the Department of Interior for mishandling Native American trust funds, along with four separate water rights lawsuits brought by Native American tribes.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Native American,African American", "date": "2010-12-08", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:10:56Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "5219123462144000", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:10:56Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: B244"},{"tags": "", "text": "The Japanese American Citizen League (JACL) joins with organizations including <a href=\"#M33\">SAALT</a> in objecting to hearings on \u201cThe Extent of Radicalization in the American Muslim Community\u201d in the U.S. House of Representatives targeting South Asian, Arab, Sikh, and Muslim Americans. Instead, they call on Congress to engage in objective dialogue about national security.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Asian American,Middle East/North Africa", "date": "2011-03", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:10:58Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "5209364222705664", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:10:58Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: M61"},{"tags": "", "text": "The White House releases Empowering Local Partners to Prevent Violent Extremism in the United States, the first national strategy to prevent violent extremism domestically. The underlying premise of the approach to Countering Violent Extremism (CVE) in the United States is that (1) communities provide the solution to violent extremism; and (2) CVE efforts are best pursued at the local level, tailored to local dynamics, where local officials continue to build relationships within their communities through established community policing and community outreach mechanisms. The pilot programs for CVE are in Greater Boston, Los Angeles, and the Twin Cities.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Middle East/North Africa", "date": "2011-08", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:11:00Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "5265951759007744", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:11:00Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: M62"},{"tags": "", "text": "Troy Davis is executed by lethal injection, despite compelling evidence of his innocence, and ignoring pleas from former president Jimmy Carter, Pope Benedict XVI, the NAACP, and 600,000 people worldwide. The act is thought of as a racial hate crime and causes public uproar.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "African American", "date": "2011-09-21", "qtype": "D", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:10:59Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "5896371622117376", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:10:59Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: B246"},{"tags": "", "text": "17-year old Trayvon Martin is fatally shot by George Zimmerman while walking home from the store. Martin was unarmed, and Zimmerman expresses Martin looked suspicious with a hooded sweatshirt on. This leads to the March 21 \u201cMillions for Hoodies\u201d in New York City.", "refs": "", "pic": "6487410661654528", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "African American", "date": "2012-02-26", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:11:01Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "6487410661654528", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:11:01Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: B247"},{"tags": "", "text": "Two pressure cooker bombs are detonated at the Boston Marathon finish line, killing 3 civilians and injuring an estimated 264 others. The suspects are identified later that day as Chechen brothers radicalized by extremist Islamist beliefs.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Middle East/North Africa", "date": "2013-04-15", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:11:10Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "6420295623639040", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:11:10Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: M63"},{"tags": "", "text": "The activist movement Black Lives Matter is founded following George Zimmerman\u2019s acquittal.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "African American", "date": "2013-07-13", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:11:09Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "6336828034514944", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:11:09Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: B253"},{"tags": "", "text": "Marc Anthony, the top selling salsa artist, sings \u201cGod Bless America\u201d at the MLB All Star games. This sparked Twitter rants with racial epithets claiming that Anthony is not actually an American, despite the fact he was born and raised in New York.", "refs": "", "pic": "4657823313035264", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Latino/as", "date": "2013-07-16", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:11:12Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "4657823313035264", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:11:12Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: L145"},{"tags": "", "text": "A federal court awards a White police officer $620,000 for a \u201creverse racism\u201d lawsuit. The officer claimed that a Black woman was hired for a job position over him because \u201cthe academy needed more color\u201d. The all White jury takes only hours to deem this a \u201creverse racism\u201d act. Due to the circumstances, the Black woman hired for the job resigns.", "refs": "[]", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "African American", "date": "2013-08-23", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:11:12Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "6191838796972032", "modified": "2018-09-12T21:21:06Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: B254"},{"tags": "", "text": "Dr. Mona Hanna-Attisha, an Iraqi immigrant, becomes credited for blowing the whistle on the Flint Michigan water crisis after she takes the unconventional step of sharing her research findings at a press conference. Levels of the heavy metal measured in city drinking water at the height of the crisis rose above the threshold for hazardous waste.", "refs": "", "pic": "6060617882402816", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Middle East/North Africa", "date": "2014-09", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:11:26Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "6060617882402816", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:11:26Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: M72"},{"tags": "", "text": "Deah Shaddy Barakat, Yusor Mohammed Abu-Salha, and Razan Mohammad Abu-Salha are shot execution-style outside their home. The case is debated as a hate crime or a dispute over a parking space.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Middle East/North Africa", "date": "2015-02-10", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:11:20Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "5822199818616832", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:11:20Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: M71"},{"tags": "", "text": "Water protectors and their allies at Standing Rock Reservation in the Dakotas gather to prevent the Dakota Access Pipeline, an oil pipeline threatening water sources and ignoring land treaties.  Water protectors encamp on the site, lead prayers and gatherings, and stand in the face of pepper spray, teargas, rubber bullets, trained dogs, percussion grenades, sonic attacks, and water cannon in sub freezing temperatures.  Activists are arrested, stripped, and kept in dog kennels with numbers written on their arms. The charges, treatment, and consequences for Native activists are witnessed to be more severe than those who are not Native. Video footage of shootings by reporters on the scene contradict official police statements. Native led resistance fosters support from a variety of sources.  Resistance eventually leads to the Army Corps of Engineers to call for a full environmental impact statement.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Native American", "date": "2016-04-2016-12", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:11:27Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "6348747374067712", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:11:27Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: N177"},{"tags": "", "text": "Genocide of Native Americans begins, resulting in the death of over nine million Native Americans by 1700. Methods used to kill Native Americans during this genocidal period included lynching, deliberate and inadvertent introduction of diseases, forced migration and other tactics. This treatment of Native Americans continued into the 1700s, when many were captured and made to work on plantations with African American slaves.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Native American", "date": "1600\u2019s", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:05:01Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "5646239437684736", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:05:01Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: N17"},{"tags": "", "text": "American Civil War. Hostilities begin when seceded slave states (grouped together as the Confederate States of America) fire on Fort Sumter in Charleston, South Carolina.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "African American", "date": "1861-04-12", "qtype": "D", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:06:07Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "4657391668822016", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:06:07Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: B66"},{"tags": "", "text": "Dr. Jokichi Takamine isolates pure epinephrine (adrenalin) at John Hopkins University. A long time resident of the U.S., Dr. Takamine declines honorary citizenship until all immigrants of Japanese ancestry are allowed the right to become citizens.", "refs": "", "pic": "4952371096453120", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Asian American", "date": "1901", "qtype": "F", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:06:54Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "4952371096453120", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:06:54Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: A48"},{"tags": "", "text": "Takao Ozawa, a Japanese immigrant, challenges the Supreme Court saying he qualifies for citizenship. His case is denied because he is not \u201cCaucasian.\u201d", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Asian American", "date": "1922", "qtype": "", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:07:14Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "5010475561517056", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:07:14Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: A71"},{"tags": "", "text": "Norsemen reach North America from Greenland and build small settlements at at L\u2019Anse aux Meadows near the northern tip of Newfoundland. There is evidence of trade with the Beothuk (related to the Algonquin) and the Thule (ancestors of the Inuit). It is likely the settlements were motivated by a need for timber as there are few trees in Greenland. ", "refs": "", "pic": "5656058538229760", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Native American", "date": "1000", "qtype": "U", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:04:23Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "5656058538229760", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:04:23Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: N7"},{"tags": "", "text": "After the decline of classic Maya culture around 900, Toltec culture begins to dominate Central America, expanding rapidly from a base at Tula in northern Mexico through Guatemala and the Yucata\u0301n peninsula. The top of their society is a warrior aristocracy that attains mythical proportions in the eyes of Central Americans long after the demise of their power. Around 1200, their dominance over the region fades.", "refs": "", "pic": "5098030885765120", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Native American", "date": "950", "qtype": "D", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:04:21Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "5098030885765120", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:04:21Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: N6"},{"tags": "", "text": "The Aztec capital of Tenochtitlan-Tlatelolco begins to rise. The term \"Aztec\" is imprecise. Properly speaking, all the Nahua-speaking peoples in the Valley of Mexico were Aztecs, while the culture that dominated the area was a tribe of the Mexica (pronounced \"me-shee-ka\") called the Tenochca (\"te-noch-ka\"). At the time of the European conquest, they called themselves either \"Tenochca\" or \"Toltec\". The Mexica migrated from the north into the Valley of Mexico after the Classic Period in Mesoamerica but as early as the twelfth century AD.", "refs": "", "pic": "", "orgid": "5757715179634688", "groups": "Native American,Latino/as", "date": "1320-1350", "qtype": "D", "categories": "", "created": "2018-04-18T17:04:24Z;5652786310021120", "instid": "5719238044024832", "modified": "2018-04-18T17:04:24Z;5652786310021120", "regions": "", "source": "ksep: N9"}]
